$schema.description: Self referencing URL to allow a distributed schema to refer to what schema validation is used for that property.

$providerListingId.description: This is the internal ID for the originating source of the rental

$providerUnitId.description: This is the internal unit ID for the originating source of the unit

$booking.description: Configuration options, which determine fields specific to the booking process for a rental. These values are accessible elsewhere, however for convenience we merge in the values to a single, more easily accessible object to assist in accessing the values.

cancellationKey.description: The cancellation key, is used instead of setting configurable values in the #/definitions/cancellations defs. The idea is that the cancellation rules may be held on a third party site, unknown to us, however we know the underlying Enums which are used. This lets us send what key should be used and you can control the actual implementation of the cancellation processes.

$marketing.description: Marketing values specific to the Listing when distributing to a website

id.description: This is the internal ID for the listing

slug.description: This is the internal slug for the listing

agent.title: Marketing Agent for Property
agent.description: When distributing schemas, it is often helpful to know who this listing is being marketed as. Oftentimes the property may be available to several partners and while the owner of the property will stay the same, the marketing agent may need to be reflected differently.

descriptiveName.title: Descriptive name of the settings record. Can be used for internal tracking and should not be displayed publicly.

publicUrl.title: URL of Logo
publicUrl.description: Where the logo for this agent can be found

brandCompanyName.title: The Official name of the marketing agent
brandCompanyName.description: This is the name of the agent marketing this listing

website.title: A Web Address for the Agent

biography.title: The Biography Schema
biography.description: A short plaintext biography for this marketing agent.

emails.title: The Emails Array for this Agent

$marketingReferenceId.description: If you have a different marketing ID to the main reference ID you can supply an additional reference code.

$brand.description: This field can be used to set a brand grouping for the rental. If you need to designate a rental as originating from a particular brand you can set any value you like.

isActive.description: Designates if this property is active.

isInstantBookable.description: Designates if this property is instant bookable and can accept payments online.

isFeatured.description: Designates if this property is featured. This field is only used where if the receiving platform accepts being supplied user-specified values for featured properties.

isDraft.description: Designates if this property is a draft and should not be published yet.

isPublishedToChannels.description: Designates if this property is available to be published to external channels.

+changeover.description: Preloaded changeover Information. 3 = can arrive and depart on date. 2 = can depart only. 1 = can arrive only. 0 = unavailable for anything.

maxDaysNotice.description: This is essentially the booking window. A max days notice of zero, means block all future dates. A value of 30 means only bookings where the arrival date is within 30 day period.

availability.description: Availability Information using Y to specify availability, and N to specify not available.

unitsAvailable.description: How many units are available for each day.

instantBookable.description: Specifies if the property is instant bookable for the given date range. Y= Can be instantly booked. N= Requires confirmation from owner or enquiry only.

changeover.description: Preloaded changeover Information. 3 = can arrive and depart on date. 2 = can depart only. 1 = can arrive only. 0 = unavailable for anything.

minPriorNotify.description: The number of minimum number of nights before the check-in that the property owner must be notified. For example, if the minPriorNotify is set to =1 then same-day check in arrivals are not available. However, if it is set to 0, then same day are allowed.

guestMakeContactXDaysBeforeArrival.description: For certain roles we may want to ask the guest to contact this person X days before arrival to ensure that they are prepared for the guests arrival.

items.description: ISO 639-1 code. For example: en, fr, de, es.

isBackground.description: This lets us know if we can use the video as a background on the pages.

static.description: The static section is legacy pricing structure. It allows us to show static tables to guests for daily and weekly pricing. It is never used in the calculation of a property for pricing.

dynamic.description: The dynamic pricing is the full pricing configuration used by the Ultimate Property Pricing format for pricing properties. It is used for real time pricing calculations and is the preferred structure for sending pricing

los.description: Allows storage of generated LOS and supplied LOS records in raw array form

base64Blob.description: Used internally. The base64Blob is a calculated encoded in base64 representation of the LOS from a simple CSV structure.

type.title: The type of the supplied LOS records
type.description: We allow LOS to be supplied to us, in a generated form. The array format is verbose enough to support specific pricing and changeover requirements.

generatedAt.title: The generatedAt schema
generatedAt.description: What time was the schema generated at

records.title: Records grouped by date as the object property

anyOf.title: Each arrival date, per guest and currency including rates for each corressponding date

date.title: The date schema
date.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

currency.title: The currency schema
currency.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

guest.title: The guests schema
guest.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

rateHash.title: Computed hash of method used to generate this price
rateHash.description: We require you to supply a rate hash. In simple terms this can be anything, but we use it to understand how you generate the pricing, and understand if something has changed in a group of similar rates. A good rate hash is the configuration used to generate this rate string. For instance, if I has a pricing configuration, I could hash the configuration. We would then expect the rateHash to remain the same, and the computed values to be deterministic if all things being the same. If we see a change of the rateHash then we know that the underlying configuration used to generate this los has been updated. Preference here is deterministic rateHash strings, however, if this is not possible a random UUID will be sufficient however certain intelligence, patching, caching features will then no longer work.

rates.title: The rates schema
rates.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

anyOf.title: The cost to stay
anyOf.description: We expect this to be an integer value. We do not support float values for supplied LOS pricing due to incompatibility on several marketplaces (such as Airbnb) which do not support float points for LOS. To avoid inconsistencies where we require integer amounts only.

cancellations.title: The cancellations schema
cancellations.description: Cancellation rules for the property. Specify the amount retained on this property. If any cancellation rules exist in this array, at least one policy must be matched.

examples.name: No cancellation 1 day before
examples.description: If you cancellation one day before, all payment forfeit

examples.name: No cancellation 1 day before
examples.description: If you cancellation one day before, all payment forfeit

name.title: The name schema
name.description: The name is the short name for this cancellation.

description.title: The description schema
description.description: We will show the full description for a cancellation if specified.
examples: If you cancellation one day before, all payment forfeit

daysBeforeArrival.title: The daysBeforeArrival schema
daysBeforeArrival.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

graceHours.title: A grace period in hours to allow total exemption/refund of the period. ie. 48 hour grace allows cancellation even if within a non-cancellation policy.
graceHours.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

percentageRetained.title: The percentageRetained schema
percentageRetained.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

unitAllocatedReference.description: If this listing is on a complex or a bed and breakfast, or a pitch on a site, it will usually have a reference ID or an allocation number.

oneOf.title: The bedroom item which it sleeps
oneOf.description: This can be supplied or calculated. If any bedroom exists within rooms, this is calculated or should match exactly the room blueprint, however, if no room exists, this can be supplied directly from the supplier with confidence that it would not be overwritten.

quantity.title: How many of this item does the unit have
